intro: Ononis pendula f. alba, commonly known as white trailing sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of small, white flowers. The plant is characterized by its thin, trailing stems and narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. This variety is distinguished by its pale white flowers, which contrast with the green foliage.
